g.text: (1) SRIOV-FEC Operator deploys K8S secret which contains VFIO token.
Token would be used during configuration all PF(s) managed by an operator.
(2) Customer applies SriofFecClusterConfig containing configuration for selected PF(s).
Requested configuration relies of vfio-pci driver.
(3) Applied SFCC is noticed by SRIOV-FEC-Daemon running on appropriate node.
Daemon configures PF(s)/VF(s), starts pf_bb_config config daemon and
(4,5) lets SRIOV-Network-Device-Plugin to reinitialize its resource pools.
(6) Customer deploys customer app relying on `intel.com/intel_fec_acc100` resource.
(7) Since VF allocated for this app has been configured with a token,
access to this VF is secured by this token (customer app need to specify token when
Diagram above, shows secret containing vfio-token mounted directly
Described scenario is simplified approach for vfio token handling.
Ultimate solution would not force user to specify token as part of customer-app manifest.
Instead, tokens would be directly injected into container of customer-app (injection
would be executed by SRIOV-NETWORK-DEVICE-PLUGIN). Unfortunatelly, this approach requires
changes in SRIOV-NETWORK-DEVICE-PLUGIN. Appropriate proposal has been discussed
with a community and reference implementation has been shared with them.
Nevertheless, discussion is still ongoing and it would take time.
Simplified solution would provide VFIO driver support into SRIOV-FEC operator
without having to wait for community approvals/decisions.
